Package stacs.yahtzee

Interface Player

public interface Player
Model for the player in a game of Yahtzee

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void endTurn()
    Tells the game that the current player has ended their turn.
    PlayerScoringOption getHighestScoringOption()
    Returns the available scoring option that has the highest score given the current dice values.
    int getPlayingOrder()
    Returns the current player's playing order in the game
    int getScore()
    Get this player's score.
    ScoreCard getScoreCard()
    Gets this player's scorecard object.
    java.util.List<PlayerScoringOption> getUnusedScoringOptionsSatisfiedByCurrentDice()
    Gets the scoring options this player has not already registered a score for, and which are satisfied by their current dice roll.
    void keepDice​(Dice keptDice)
    This enables a player to 'keep' certin dice that they have previously rolled within the current round so that they are not rolled on subsequent rolls within the current round.
    void rollDice​(java.util.List<Dice> dice)
    This method calls the 'roll' method on a list of dice objects.
    void unKeepDice​(Dice unKeptDice)
    This allows the player to reverse their decision to 'keep' a certain dice.
    boolean useScoringOptionAndEndTurn​(PlayerScoringOption scoringOption)
    Called by the player when they wish to mark their scorecard for a particular scoring option.

  • Method Details

    • getPlayingOrder

      int getPlayingOrder()
      Returns the current player's playing order in the game

    • rollDice

      void rollDice​(java.util.List<Dice> dice)
      This method calls the 'roll' method on a list of dice objects. The list of dice objects is the game's dice objects, less the dice the player may have elected to 'keep' after the previous role. If it is their first roll of the round, they must roll all the dice.

    • keepDice

      void keepDice​(Dice keptDice)
      This enables a player to 'keep' certin dice that they have previously rolled within the current round so that they are not rolled on subsequent rolls within the current round.
      Parameters:
      keptDice - The dice the player has elected not to roll.

    • unKeepDice

      void unKeepDice​(Dice unKeptDice)
      This allows the player to reverse their decision to 'keep' a certain dice.
      Parameters:
      unKeptDice - The dice that the player will no longer 'keep'

    • getScore

      int getScore()
      Get this player's score.

    • getUnusedScoringOptionsSatisfiedByCurrentDice

      java.util.List<PlayerScoringOption> getUnusedScoringOptionsSatisfiedByCurrentDice()
      Gets the scoring options this player has not already registered a score for, and which are satisfied by their current dice roll.
      Returns:
      A list of scoring options that are fulfilled with the users current dice and which they have not already used

    • getHighestScoringOption

      PlayerScoringOption getHighestScoringOption()
      Returns the available scoring option that has the highest score given the current dice values.
      Returns:
      The highest scoring option.

    • getScoreCard

      ScoreCard getScoreCard()
      Gets this player's scorecard object.

    • useScoringOptionAndEndTurn

      boolean useScoringOptionAndEndTurn​(PlayerScoringOption scoringOption)
      Called by the player when they wish to mark their scorecard for a particular scoring option. This must be called exactly once during each of this player's turn, and when it is called, it ends their turn.
      Parameters:
      scoringOption - The scoring option which this person will take. The score will be calculated automatically and registered in the scorecard card object by the "player score option" object.
      Returns:
      Returns true if the operation is succesful. Returns false if the player attempted to mark

    • endTurn

      void endTurn()
      Tells the game that the current player has ended their turn. This is called from the 'applyScoringOptionAndEndTurn' method.
